comment.body: Can we get rid of `any` here? To make sure returned data has correct type

pull_request.title: [ACS-6227] cleanup error handling and fix typing issues
pull_request.body:
**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**

> - [x] The commit message follows our [guidelines](https://github.com/Alfresco/alfresco-ng2-components/wiki/Commit-format)
> - [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
> - [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

<!--
 Before submitting your PR, please check that your code follows our contribution guidelines:
 https://github.com/Alfresco/alfresco-ng2-components/wiki/Code-contribution-acceptance-criteria
 -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check one with "x")

> - [x] Bugfix
> - [ ] Feature
> - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
> - [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
> - [ ] Build related changes
> - [ ] Documentation
> - [ ] Other... Please describe:


**What is the current behaviour?** (You can also link to an open issue here)



**What is the new behaviour?**

- remove useless ajax mocking tests that verify the mock instead of real logic
- remove useless rethrowing of the errors
- fix typing issues found after cleaning up rethrowing and `any` types

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one with "x")

> - [ ] Yes
> - [x] No


If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications: ...

**Other information**:
https://alfresco.atlassian.net/browse/ACS-6227

comment.body: I think we can simplify this part by using switch case on `filter.name` setting `filter` variable and then after switch case block we could push new `FilterRepresentationModel` only once with correct params, since between those if else blocks then only changing variable is the `filter` itself. It would be quite a simpler and shorter this way

We were trying to use this type to handle simple links but at some point we realized that it isn't the best place and we are going to compose another type in the future. But because I spent some time here I took this opportunity and made a small code refactor.

Small thing but probably can be just: 

this.displayText$.next(group.displayName || group.id);
